content:
Within PCWG for the past month or so we have been discussing the concept of "ownership" of "custodian" of a Care Plan and how FHIR Care Plan resource is missing this.
I finally created the JIRA for this: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-28544

We also discussed, in the meantime- since the NIH NIDDK TEP feels strongly that there be a Care Plan "owner", within the MCC IG that I should create an extension for this. I have learned that though extensions in FHIR are welcomed - I see the statement,
"To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Although any implementer can define and use extensions, there is a set of requirements that must be met as part of their use and definition."

But, I am not seeing what exactly these "governance rules" and "requirements" are.

Are the rules here? https://www.hl7.org/fhir/extensibility.html

What is involved in complying with the "governance"?
@Grahame Grieve Do you know what "set of requirements" we were referring to?
that's very old language, and those are in general statements of principle

But in practice, there are no hoops to jump through, correct?

Should we yank that language?
well, we should do something about it. Providing some actual guidance would be better than removing language saying there should be criteria and governance
@Yunwei Wang can you put this on our FHIR-I agenda? I'll poke Anne about adding it to the FMG agenda
